subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The Seattle Mariners hired the Milwaukee Brewers special assistant Jack Zduriencik as their new general manager. Zduriencik, 57, replaces Bill Bavasi, who was fired in June, and takes over for the interim Lee Pelekoudas. Zduriencik is known for his skill in drafting players. Since Zduriencik arrived in Milwaukee in 1999, the team drafted Prince Fielder and Rickie Weeks as well as the 2007 National League rookie of the year, Ryan Braun, J. J. Hardy, Corey Hart, Yovani Gallardo, Manny Parra and Tony Gwynn Jr.
